title: Establishing second-brain architecture and session closing ritual

summary.high_level: Designed and implemented a local-first, scene-based, graph-ready second brain architecture. Established repository structure, node ID conventions, session artifact schema, and formal session closing checklist. Clarified scene-based vs type-based file organization and finalized README.
key_decisions: Adopt scene-based file organization rather than one-node-per-file.
Use stable node IDs as architectural anchors; folders are non-canonical.
Every meaningful session must emit a structured artifact on close.
Keep infrastructure local and tool-agnostic (no DB yet).
Implement session closing checklist to enforce discipline.
changes_made: Created repository structure with scenes/, sessions/, templates/, graph/.
Wrote README defining architecture and workflow.
open_questions: When should session artifacts be auto-generated instead of manual copy/save?
Should graph/graph.json become canonical or remain derived?
When to introduce validation tooling or CLI support?
How to query across sessions without full DB infrastructure?

notes_for_future_agents: This session establishes the architectural baseline of the system. Future changes should preserve scene-based organization and stable node IDs.
Do not prematurely introduce complex storage infrastructure without clear need.
Ensure future sessions continue emitting structured artifacts to maintain continuity.
